result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Brandon G Stindle

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Brandon G Stindle appeared by video.  Attorney Joseph Thomas Domask appeared by video for Brandon G Stindle.  Prosecuting attorney Navjot Singh Hira in court for the State of Wisconsin. Deputy court clerk cmt.
Hearing held via Zoom. state in compliance with victim notification. Defense requests a plea and sentencing date. Case adjourned, Branch 15. Plea and sentencing scheduled for 11-17-2022 at 2:00 pm.

Defendant Brandon G Stindle in Court.  Attorney Joseph Thomas Domask appeared by video for Brandon G Stindle.  Attorney Navjot Singh Hira in Court for State of Wisconsin. 

Case in Court for Bail/Bond hearing. Discussion placed on the record. Defendant posted Cash Bail; therefore, Defense no longer requested to address Bail. Attorney Domask was recently appointed by the Public Defender's Office. Attorney Domask has not had an opportunity to meet with Defendant. State to provide Defense with discovery material and an offer. Court ordered case adjourned for Status Conference. Case remains calendared in Branch 15. Status conference scheduled for September 12, 2022 at 09:00 am.
JusticePoint PreTrial Services Supervision Report dated August 30, 2022; received and filed.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with EMJ (d.o.b. 12/16/98).
Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 3. No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Brandon G Stindle appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Fred Richardson III appeared by video for Brandon G Stindle.  Attorney Karine O'Byrne appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge J.D. Watts, Branch 15.   Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant pled not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Case is adjourned to Branch 15 for pretrial conference. 
This hearing MAY be streamed live on Dacast: https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/104d9737-ba2f-8811-9083-aed2135824d9
Bail/bond hearing scheduled for August 31, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
